intro: Alonsoa bidentata, commonly known as the two-toothed alonsoa, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves with two distinct teeth on the margins. It produces small, showy flowers that are typically pink or red in color. Alonsoa bidentata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
